H0.text: Second is what enzymes can catalyze up to several million reactions per.

H1.text: Minute is the unit of time in which enzymes can catalyze up to several million reactions.

H2.text: Hour is the unit in which enzymes can catalyze up to several million reactions per hour.

H3.text: Day is the unit in which enzymes can catalyze up to several million reactions per.

A4.text: These enzymes are so efficient they effectively catalyse a reaction each time they encounter a substrate molecule and have thus reached an upper theoretical limit for efficiency (diffusion limit);

A5.text: The average values of k2/KM and k2 are about 10^5 s^-1 M^-1 and 10 s^-1, respectively.

A7.text: The catalytic constant (k_cat) is the rate of product formation when the enzyme is saturated with substrate and therefore reflects the enzyme's maximum rate.
